channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What it's like to party in the native habitat of Groundhog Day star Punxsutawney Phil
item.description: It was a full-on party in Punxsutawney this weekend. "This is my favorite holiday," one local says of the fuss-free day, adding, "You don't have to even see your in-laws."
item.content:encoded: It was a full-on party in Punxsutawney this weekend. "This is my favorite holiday," one local says of the fuss-free day, adding, "You don't have to even see your in-laws."
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Astronomers are tracking an asteroid that could hit Earth in 2032
item.description: The odds are about 1% that the football field-sized object could hit the Earth, but that makes it the closest call in more than 20 years.
item.content:encoded:
The odds are about 1% that the football field-sized object could hit the Earth, but that makes it the closest call in more than 20 years.

(Image credit: Sergey Hametov)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Did your date give you 'the ick'? Here's the science behind the feeling
item.description: You know that feeling when someone you're dating does this one thing that you just can't look past? Here's what scientists say about why we react this way and whether the feeling is reversible.
item.content:encoded: You know that feeling when someone you're dating does this one thing that you just can't look past? Here's what scientists say about why we react this way and whether the feeling is reversible.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Muraskin

item.title: Fidgeting at your desk? Your body may be trying to tell you something
item.description: That spontaneous restless movement plays an important role in our health. Here's what to do the next time you find yourself bouncing your knee or clicking and unclicking your pen.
item.content:encoded:
Rethink Your Position. That spontaneous movement can be your body's way of telling you it's time to move.'/>

That spontaneous restless movement plays an important role in our health. Here's what to do the next time you find yourself bouncing your knee or clicking and unclicking your pen.

(Image credit: Kiersten Essenpreis for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: How did racist mass texts bypass some anti-spam guardrails after the election?
item.description: Americans across the country received harmful hate messages via text after the election. The communication industry has been trying to figure out how it happened.
item.content:encoded:
Americans across the country received harmful hate messages via text after the election. The communication industry has been trying to figure out how it happened.

(Image credit: Daniel Hertzberg for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jenna McLaughlin

item.title: On the frontline against bird flu, egg farmers fear they're losing the battle
item.description: The tools the US used to contain previous bird flu outbreaks just aren't working this time, according to some agricultural experts. Some egg farmers have called for vaccinations for poultry.
item.content:encoded:
The tools the US used to contain previous bird flu outbreaks just aren't working this time, according to some agricultural experts. Some egg farmers have called for vaccinations for poultry.

(Image credit: Terry Chea)
item.dc:creator: Kate Wells

item.title: Israel's Netanyahu heads to U.S. to meet with Trump
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Sunday he will discuss "victory over Hamas," countering Iran and expanding diplomatic relations with Arab countries in his meeting with President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Sunday he will discuss "victory over Hamas," countering Iran and expanding diplomatic relations with Arab countries in his meeting with President Trump.

(Image credit: Maya Alleruzzo)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: D.C. crash investigators focus on altitude and vision quality of helicopter crew
item.description: Investigators are still working to piece together key details to determine the cause of the crash that killed 67 people.
item.content:encoded:
Investigators are still working to piece together key details to determine the cause of the crash that killed 67 people.

(Image credit: Samuel Corum)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Elon Musk's X sues Lego, Nestlé and more brands, accusing them of advertising boycott
item.description: The new defendants added into the legal filing included Lego, Nestlé, Tyson Foods, Abbott Laboratories, Colgate-Palmolive, Pinterest and Shell International.
item.content:encoded:
The new defendants added into the legal filing included Lego, Nestlé, Tyson Foods, Abbott Laboratories, Colgate-Palmolive, Pinterest and Shell International.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Trump imposes new tariffs on imports from Mexico, Canada and China in new phase of trade war
item.description: Starting Tuesday, nearly all imports from Canada and Mexico will be charged a 25% tariff, while goods from China will be charged a 10% tariff.
item.content:encoded:
Starting Tuesday, nearly all imports from Canada and Mexico will be charged a 25% tariff, while goods from China will be charged a 10% tariff.

(Image credit: Alfredo Estrella)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley
